objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yoshiko Shitamae [1]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko
objects.description: The letter was written in two parts. The first part of the letter expresses how she wished he would be released from his internment camp and be reunited with the family. She goes on to talk about the activities and classes she has begun taking. The second part of the letter discusses the weather, graduation ceremonies, news of their business and concern of their stored belongings. She also discusses the events of the Fourth of July.

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Fumiko Shitamae [3]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Fumiko
objects.description: Letter talks about how Shihei's (George's) last letter was heavily censored and they couldn't make out what he was saying. Fumiko goes on to discuss her work at the office where she filled out repatriation forms for those wishing to return to Japan. She goes on to update him on some financial matters and discusses sumo or judo tournament.

objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko

objects.creator: Shitamae, Miyoko
objects.description: Letter telling him that they wil be transfered to Eden, Idaho with better conditions and barracks, disucssing hot weather, talks about the censorship of his previous letters, tells him of the down time listening to niehgbors playing ukulele afterwork, Miyoko talks about their work in the hospital and how much they like it

objects.creator: Shitamae, Fumiko
objects.description: Letter telling him that they are being trasnfered to Idaho and are saddened by leaving Washington because it is so close to home

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Fumiko Shitamae [7]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Fumiko
objects.description: Letter telling him that they are in Idaho and it is much different than Washington, it is very dusty and flat surrounded by sage, rattlesnakes and rabbits, the barracks. Fumiko says that they are contributing to the future of America by bulding something on all the flat land
objects.subject: travel;Idaho;dust;buildings (structures)

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Midori Fujii [1]
objects.creator: Fujii, Midori
objects.description: Letter telling him that they have just been transfered to Idaho and the train ride there was dificult but the meals were good. States that Idaho is dusty and expressed dissapointment that it will be their permanent home, cautions George of rattlesnakes.

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Miyoko Shitamae [3]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Miyoko
objects.description: Letter telling him about their transfer and how beautiful the scenery was on the train but how dusty and flat it got when they arrivd in Minidoka, Idaho. It discusses the structures of the new camp and the buildings that make up a little community, including a hospital which Miyoko wants to work at again but the walk is over 2 miles and the dust makes it very challenging.

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Miyoko Shitamae [4]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Miyoko
objects.description: Letter telling him about a terrible dust storm and compared it to Seattle rain only it was dust, Miyoko encolsed a piece of sage brush to see if George had any of that plant in New Mexico.
objects.subject: scenery (landscape);dust;

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yoshiko Shitamae [4]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko
objects.description: Letter telling him about the details of their transfer and all the scenery they saw along the way, when they arrived at Twin Falls dust was everywhere.The Barracks are big and have more windows and the town is 2 -3 miles long, 8th biggest in Idaho. Yoshi talks about school starting and having to teach and catch up their younger sibling with arithmetic and spelling in time for school.
objects.subject: scenery (landscape);dust; buildings (structures);trains (vehicle groupings)

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Miyoko Shitamae [5]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Miyoko
objects.description: Letter telling him that the family was getting over diarrhea and sickness but everyone is getting better now. The weather had been changing and they had discovered a bed of water just outside of their camp that the dust hid, some people even caught fish to eat.
objects.subject: leisure;illness;activities (general context);weather

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Fumiko Shitamae [8]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Fumiko
objects.description: Letter telling him about working in the hospital and people in the camp getting over the stomach flu. Their father has returned from the hospital and is no longer suffereing from the flu and before. Also talks about sending celery juice to him but has to get it from town. States that the family and others in the camp are getting used the camp and settling in, talks about starting to grow produce next year.
objects.subject: weather;illness;powers of attorney;
objects.rights: In Copyright. Educational Use only. Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yoshiko Shitamae [5]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko
objects.description: Letter telling him about how a few members of the family are still sick and staying home together but they have a stove so they do not freeze. Papa is trying to build furtinure in front of the stove but it isn't easy and is frustrating him. Yoshiko is not working at the hospital but Fumiko and Miyoko are. Yoshiko wanted to send a picture but the government confiscated all cameras during forced relocation, asks George to send a picture of himself.
objects.subject: weather;illness;cameras (photographic equipment);occupations (livelihoods)

objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko
objects.description: Letter telling him about how a few members of the family are still sick and staying home together but they have a stove so they do not freeze. Papa is trying to build furtinure in front of the stove but it isn't easy and is frustrating him. Yoshiko is not working at the hospital but Fumiko and Miyoko are. Yoshiko wanted to send a picture but the government confiscated all cameras during forced relocation, asks George to send a picture of himself.

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yoshiko Shitamae [7]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko
objects.description: Letter teling him that the family misses him terribly and are hearing talks of famiies being reunited together soon, she compares it to a bad dream being separted. it had started so snow in Idaho and that has made the landscape beautiful. They had a nice Thanksgiving in the dining hall and are preparing for Christmas
objects.subject: weather;holidays;

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Miyoko Shitamae [6]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Miyoko
objects.description: Letter expressing frustration that all mail is going through New York and then down to its addressed destination. The letter also asks if the celery extract came and what it is used for. It continues to snow and that means everyone is cramped in the house but Papa has made furniture and shelves so things can be stored out of the way. She also talks about her child and wishes George could watch them grow.
objects.subject: weather;working;children (people by age group);family life

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yoshiko Shitamae [8]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko
objects.description: Letter telling him that they miss him and hope he is in good health. Talks about the Christmas decorating compeition between the mess halls. Also thanks George for all of the wonderful gifts he sent and that they are knitting him something as well. Also details Yoshiko's school schedule that is from 8-5 and leave all of the kids very tired.
objects.subject: gifts (object genre);holidays;diaries;education

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Fumiko Shitamae [9]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Fumiko
objects.description: Letter telling him about the Christmas celebration and how they brought in the new year with Mochi and good thoughts. The family loves all of the gifts he had made them for Christmas and displays them proudly, and misses him dearly. They all helped to knit him a sweater in time for the holidays but just sent it out.
objects.subject: gifts (object genre);holidays;hope
objects.rights: In Copyright. Educational Use only. Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yoshiko Shitamae [9]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko
objects.description: Letter apologizing for not writing more frequently but that the family thinks of him all the time and wishes and does not understand why they cannot all be together. Details their holidays and asks him if he got to do anything enjoyable. Asks about his high blood pressure and tells him to be careful of eating a lot of meat. Promises to write him more often and misses him.
objects.subject: holidays;weather;entertainment
objects.rights: In Copyright. Educational Use only. Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions assigned by University of Idaho Library. For more information, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Miyoko Shitamae [7]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Miyoko
objects.description: Letter talking about Seattle and how different it is and if they would even want to go back after the war and if Japanese will even be accepted there. Fumiko is leaving the camp because she got accepted to go to college in Ohio and that means Miyoko has to take over one some responsibilities. She reflecting on the circumstances they are in and states to not take anything forgranted.

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yoshiko Shitamae [10]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko
objects.description: Letter talking about how the family all had colds but everyone is feeling better and back in good health. Talks about the high school, its name, mascot and school colors. Talks about George's great vocabulary and his niece being a spoiled but happy child.
objects.subject: illness;education

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Fumiko Shitamae [10]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Fumiko
objects.description: Letter talking about Fumiko getting ready to leave to go to Ohio for college. Camp life has spead up and there are recruiters for the Japanese Combat unit.

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yoshiko Shitamae [11]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko
objects.description: Letter telling him that Fumiko has left for college and traveled with a friend. Yoshiko apologizes to him that he has been relocated for a fourth time and the family is thinking about him. They are replanting the garden again because the plants died and rabbits eat their crops.They are planning to send him some paper cherry blosssoms that they crafted.Check's up on George's blood pressure.
objects.subject: college students;travel;weather;activities (general context);health

objects.title: Transcription of Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Miyoko Shitamae [8]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Miyoko
objects.description: Letter telling him about the Spring weather. Also about Fumiko's experience in college and how much she likes it. Also asked about his blood pressure and if he needs any more celery extract. Talks about relocation to the middle east or west like Chicago but Miyoko doesn't want to live in a big city but start out smaller somewhere else.
objects.subject: relocation;travel;weather;college students;family life

objects.creator: Fujii, Midori
objects.description: Letter asking him about his transfer to Santa Fe and the weather. It was Midori's 11th birthdya and they had a party and got a book as a present, also taking piano lessons. Since the weather is getting hotter they are going to the canal.
objects.subject: celebrations;weather;activities (general context)

objects.title: Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yukiko Fujii [1]
objects.creator: Fujii, Yukiko
objects.description: Letter asking him about the hot weather, informs him of the families and children. People are returning to camp but that makes them miss him even more. They are moving inland in August but they don't know where. Yukiko's husband says that they are allowing people to return to Japan but they are torn and asks if he has thought of this as well.

objects.title: Letter to Mrs. Fujii
objects.description: Letter telling discusses the weather. The letter states the the writer was recruited by the Army. Things are becoming more mild and calm, although the family is still torn between going back to Japan and staying here.

objects.title: Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yoshiko Shitamae [4]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko
objects.description: Letter asking if he had a happy Christmas, stating that it was hard for them to be happy with all of the family scattered apart.Talks about the decoration contest and what place they got. She wishes that he could come and visit in the Spring like the other family members.
objects.subject: holidays
objects.rights: In Copyright. Educational Use only. Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. objects.title: Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yoshiko Shitamae [5]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko
objects.description: Letter thanking him for the gifts and tells him not to worry about the family's health because everyone is doing fine. Talks about the dog and the dreary weather.
objects.subject: holidays;wars

objects.title: Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yukiko Fujii [4]
objects.creator: Fujii, Yukiko
objects.description: Letter thanking him for the gifts and asks more about his rehearing. Also writes that an American has sent a letter vouching for him and that totals to 3 people working to get him a rehearing.
objects.subject: hearings (event); loyalty;gifts

objects.title: Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Fumiko Shitamae  [1]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Fumiko
objects.description: Letter telling him about the weather in Idaho, it is very cold in the morning but gets gradually hotter in the day. Fumiko is getting bored of the tasks they do when work is done and asks George what he does when he is done with work. Discussion of the Power of an Attorney is in this letter and details about a business license.
objects.subject: leisure;weather;powers of attorney;licenses

objects.title: Transcription of Letter (not addressed)
objects.description: Letter wishing everyone a health season and thanking their family for being so kind to their own family.
objects.subject: health

objects.title: Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Fumiko Shitamae [2]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Fumiko
objects.description: Letter telling him that they are back in Hunt with the family and wish he was there so they could all celebrate together. Asks about an update on his rehearing. Says camp life is the same, talks about the Victory gardens. Says they will be leaving soon to go back to school and work in the east.
objects.subject: education;weather;celebrations;hearings (event);travel

objects.title: Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yukiko Fujii [5]
objects.creator: Fujii, Yukiko
objects.description: Letter telling him that a reliable source says his rehearing is scheduled in mid June, 1944, saying the condition of your health will be a significant factor.
objects.subject: hearings (event);health;travel

objects.title: Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yoshiko Shitamae [6]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko
objects.description: Letter thanking him for the photo he recently sent of himself. Fumiko visited camp during a break from school and they had a great time, dropped her off in Spokane at the end and enjoyed lunch there at a park. Talks about recent travels and the beautiful environment, school statrs soon and she is thinking about whether to go to college or not.
objects.subject: hearings (event);health;travel;activities (general context);education;photographs

objects.title: Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yoshiko Shitamae [7]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko
objects.description: Letter telling him that she is graduating in two weeks and is still unsure about college or work. She asks about his rehearing and says that the families here are all very anxiously waiting for the outcome. Asks about the weather and if there are any changes to the plants around him.Says the camp is thining out because boys and men are being drafted for active duty and going overseas.
objects.subject: education;health;gardening;hearings (event);military draft;weather;activities (general context)
objects.rights: In Copyright. Educational Use only. Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. objects.title: Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Fumiko Shitamae [3]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Fumiko
objects.description: Letter telling him that she is going to Santa Fe on the way back to Idaho to visit him. Wishing him well on his reheareing today and cannot understand why he would not get a fair trial and hopes that it is successful. She is finished with college and is going to be working in the hospital in Philadelphia and Miyoko will be up there with her soon.
objects.subject: education;health;travel;weather;hearings (event);trials
objects.rights: In Copyright. Educational Use only. Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. objects.title: Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yukiko Fujii [6]
objects.creator: Fujii, Yukiko
objects.description: Letter telling him that they are concerned with his health and hope he gets well soon. Tells hims that the success of the hearing makes the family happy and hopes that he will return to the family. She pleads him to tell her the condition of his health so she can work on trying to get him paroled sooner.
objects.subject: health;weather;hearings (event);parole

objects.title: Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Yoshiko Shitamae [8]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Yoshiko
objects.description: Letter telling him the family is concerned about his recent hospitalization from high blood pressure, asks about his rehearing. Since she has graduated she is staring vocational school to continue to learn how to type and write.
objects.subject: health;hospitalizations;weather;education

objects.title: Letter to Shihei (George) Shitamae from Miyoko Shitamae [3]
objects.creator: Shitamae, Miyoko
objects.description: Letter stating that they are concerned for his health since he was just admitted into the hospital. She had gone to see a former boss in Philadelphia to see if there was anything the could do about your hearing. She is working at the National Japanese American Student Relocation Council Office to help young people integrate back into outside schools. She talks about the people she is staying with and how they treat her like their own daughter.
objects.subject: health;education;occupations (livelihoods);hospitalizations;weather;

objects.creator: Fujii, Ayako
objects.description: Letter asking about the weather and was concerned about his sickness and hopes he will get better. They are going to school and are excited to be going into the built in block swimming pool soon.
